comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Most likely Dr. William W. Christmas (1865–1960), American aviation pioneer and designer of the Christmas Bullet aircraft (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas_Bullet). In World War I he intended to kidnap the Kaiser with a squadron of his planned steel biplanes (see also Silver Bullets II by James Edwards A BRIEF HISTORY OF AERONAUICS by J. J. Lankes, Langley Field, 1946. says that Christmas was granted a patent as the inventor of the interconnected ailerons and that he was recorded as the third man to make a public flight in America.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks B-59. I was able to find another photo that confirms this is Dr. William Whitney Christmas, American aviator and aircraft designer. We'll add his full name to our catalog record.
